dalserver.tap

Class TapSchemaDS

  • java.lang.Object
    • dalserver.tap.TapSchemaDS

  • public class TapSchemaDS
extends java.lang.Object
    Given a DataSource to a TAP_SCHEMA, returns a TapSchema object containing the TAP_SCHEMA data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TapSchemaDS

        public TapSchemaDS()
        Construct a new TapSchemaDS using the specified DataSource. As an extension mechanism, this class will attempt to load a subclass and delegate to it. The delegate class muct be named ca.nrc.cadc.tap.schema.TapSchemaDSImpl and have a no-arg constructor.
        Parameters:
        dataSource - TAP_SCHEMA DataSource.

    • Method Detail

      • setDataSource

        public void setDataSource(javax.sql.DataSource dataSource)

      • setOrdered

        public void setOrdered(boolean ordered)

      • get

        public TapSchema get()
        Creates and returns a TapSchema object representing all of the data in TAP_SCHEMA.
        Returns:
        TapSchema containing all of the data from TAP_SCHEMA.

      • appendWhere

        protected java.lang.String appendWhere(java.lang.String tapSchemaTablename,
                           java.lang.String sql)
        Append a where clause to the query that selects from the specified table. The default impl does nothing (returns in the provided SQL as-is).

        If you want to implement some additional conditions, such as having private columns only visible to certain authenticated and authorized users, you can append some conditions (or re-write the query as long as the select-list is not altered) here.

        Parameters:
        sql -
        Returns:
        modified SQL

      • getFunctionDescs

        protected java.util.List<FunctionDesc> getFunctionDescs()
        Get white-list of supported functions. TAP implementors that want to allow additiopnal functions to be used in queries to be used should override this method, call super.getFunctionDescs(), and then add additional FunctionDesc descriptors to the list before returning it.
        Returns:
        white list of allowed functions
